app.main module¶

class app.main.App[source]¶

Bases: Tk

# APP

The app class is useful to create the root page. In these class you define the parameters of the root window.

Inside this class you can call 2 different method

on_close_root()[source]¶

  • This function is useful to close the root window and to stop the algorithm if it was started.

refresh()[source]¶

  • This function is useful to refresh the page when a language change occurs.

app.main.setup()[source]¶

  • During the setup function are determined some important depndencies like the current path of the project, the current SO and processor architecture and also the current language

    which is standard set on italian language. Moreover if you have connected the serial ports of your arduino devices, they are automatically connected and setted into the data cache.

    If you want to modify the latter, just go to the settings and set the configuration according to your needs.

app.GUI_refactored module¶

class app.GUI_refactored.GUI(container)[source]¶

Bases: Frame

The GUI class is the core of this application, it contains the main buttons to create, remove or modify locomotive and also control them.

Furthermore is possible to open the circuit window in order to control the circuit Turnouts and to access to the other functionality.

Other information are available in the information button where is insert a demo to perform the program.

Settings could be manage through the settings button, there you could modify the settings dealing with the serial ports connected to the arduino’s systems.

self.container.bind(“<o>”, lambda event: self.on_off())

self.container.bind(“<i>”, lambda event: self.open_info_window())

-+ -> Press the button add locomotive

self.container.bind(“<plus>”, lambda event: self.open_locomotive_creation_window())

– -> Press the remove button

self.container.bind(“<minus>”, lambda event: self.open_locomotive_remove_window())

-m -> Press the modify button

self.container.bind(“<m>”, lambda event: self.open_locomotive_modify_window())

-Enter -> Start oor Stop the system without cutting of the current

self.container.bind(“<Return>”, lambda event: self.GENERAL_STOP_START())

app.comandi module¶

The purpose of this file is to comunicate with arduino directly by the serial port. With these command you could be able to control both the system and all the locomotives.

app.comandi.STOP(memoria, ID)[source]¶

  • This function allow you to stop a specific locomotive. It takes as arguments: memoryRegister and LocomotiveID.

It uses the same command of throttle but direction and speed are fixed to stop the locomotive.

app.comandi.cambia_deviatoio(Turnout_ID)[source]¶

  • This function allow you to modify the Turnout’s state. It takes as argument the TurnoutID.

# <Z ID ACTIVATE>:

sets output ID to either the “active” or “inactive” state

ID: the numeric ID (0-32767) of the output to control

ACTIVATE: 0 (active) or 1 (inactive)

app.comandi.change_id(current_ID, new_ID)[source]¶

  • This function allow you to modify the LocomotiveID of a specific locomotive. It takes as arguments: current LocomotiveID and the new LocomotiveID.

# <w [CAB] CV VALUE>

writes, without any verification, a Configuration Variable to the decoder of an engine on the main operations track.

– CAB: the short (1-127) or long (128-10293) address of the engine decoder

– CV: the number of the Configuration Variable memory location in the decoder to write to (1-1024), The number 1 is related to the locomotiveID.

– VALUE: the value to be written to the Configuration Variable memory location (0-255)

app.comandi.crea_deviatoio(Turnout_ID, pin)[source]¶

  • This function allow you to save the TurnoutID. It takes as arguments: TurnouID and the pin related to it.

# <Z ID PIN IFLAG>:

creates a new output ID, with specified PIN and IFLAG values. if output ID already exists, it is updated with specificed PIN and IFLAG.

note: output state will be immediately set to ACTIVE/INACTIVE and pin will be set to HIGH/LOW according to IFLAG value specifcied (see below).

– ID: the numeric ID (0-32767) of the output to control

– PIN: the arduino pin number to use for the output

– IFLAG: defines the operational behavior of the output based on bits 0, 1, and 2 as follows:

—

    1. -IFLAG, bit 0:

0 = forward operation (ACTIVE=HIGH / INACTIVE=LOW)

1 = inverted operation (ACTIVE=LOW / INACTIVE=HIGH)

—

    1. -IFLAG, bit 1:

0 = state of pin restored on power-up to either ACTIVE or INACTIVE depending on state before power-down; state of pin set to INACTIVE when first created

1 = state of pin set on power-up, or when first created, to either ACTIVE of INACTIVE depending on IFLAG, bit 2

—

    1. -IFLAG, bit 2:

0 = state of pin set to INACTIVE uponm power-up or when first created

1 = state of pin set to ACTIVE uponm power-up or when first created

app.comandi.name_serial_port()[source]¶

  • This function update the serial port’s name that deal with the dcc control unit

app.comandi.open_current(on)[source]¶

  • This function allow you to open the current o shut down it. It takes as argument 0 or 1 and then passes the command <0> or <1> to the arduino

– <1> enables power from the motor shield to the main operations and programming tracks

– <0> disables power from the motor shield to the main operations and programming tracks

app.comandi.throttle(memoria, ID, SPEED, DIR)[source]¶

  • This function allow you to set the speed of a specific locomotive. It takes as arguments: memoryRegister, LocomotiveID, speeed and Direction.

# <t REGISTER CAB SPEED DIRECTION>

Sets the throttle for a given register/cab combination

– REGISTER: an internal register number, from 1 through MAX_MAIN_REGISTERS (inclusive), to store the DCC packet used to control this throttle setting

– CAB: the short (1-127) or long (128-10293) address of the engine decoder

– SPEED: throttle speed from 0-126, or -1 for emergency stop (resets SPEED to 0)

– DIRECTION: 1=forward, 0=reverse. Setting direction when speed=0 or speed=-1 only effects directionality of cab lighting for a stopped train

app.data module¶

app.data.sensor_response = ['_/_']¶

Se partono da 7 viaggiano verso sinistra e cominciano alla stazione

1-GCDEFHG -> Schiva A e B -> Ricomincia da G, GCDEFHG 2-GCDEFG -> Schiva A,B,H -> Ricomincia da G, GCDEFG 3-GCDEFHD -> Schiva A e B -> Ricomincia da D, DEFHD 4-GCDEBA -> Schiva F e H -> Finisce in deposito, A 5-GCDEBC -> Schiva A,F,H -> Ricomincia Da C, CDEB

1A 2B 3C 4D 5E 6F 7G 8H

6-ABEDCGFE -> Schiva H -> Ricomincia da E, EDCGFE 7-ABEDHFE -> Schiva C e G -> Ricomincia da E, EDHFE 8-ABEDCB -> Schiva F,G,H -> Ricomincia da B, BEDCB 9-ABEDCGHFE -> Non schiva niente -> Ricomincia Da E, EDCGHF
